title: How to Easily Disable S Mode in Windows 10

steps.title: Open your Windows Settings.
steps.content: Open your Windows Settings. Click the Windows Start menu at the bottom-left corner of the screen, and then select the Settings gear icon. Only administrators can disable S Mode. Be sure to log into an account that has administrative privileges . Turning off S Mode is irreversible. Once you disable it, it cannot be re-enabled.

steps.title: Click Update & Security .
steps.content: Click Update & Security . It's the button that has a refresh icon that looks like 2 arrows that form a circle.

steps.title: Click Activation.
steps.content: Click Activation . You'll find this in the panel on the left side of the window.

steps.title: Click Go to the Store.
steps.content: Click Go to the Store . You'll find this under the "Switch to Windows 10 Home" or "Switch to Windows 10 Pro" headers. Do not click this under "Upgrade your edition of Windows." If you aren't in S Mode, you won't see the previous options.

steps.title: Click Get next to "Switch out of S Mode.
steps.content: Click Get next to "Switch out of S Mode. " The wording here may vary slightly, but it will be similar. When your Windows 10 PC switches out of S Mode, you'll receive an email confirmation that you'll be able to install and run apps outside of the Microsoft Store.
